physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Asymptomatic erythematous, scaly patches on the ventral aspect of the glans penis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially demonstrated scaly patches, which evolved into widespread erythematous, scaly patches nearly 3 years later.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Biopsy specimen showed epidermal hyperplasia with a moderate degree of cellular atypia.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial biopsy indicated nonspecific lichenoid dermatitis; a second biopsy showed progression to full-thickness, severe cytologic atypia characteristic of squamous cell carcinoma in situ.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Brisk and generalized erosive response to 5% imiquimod cream.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Followed by re-epithelialization of the glans despite ongoing application of imiquimod.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Several biopsy specimens taken revealed normal epidermis post-treatment.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progression from severe atypia to normal epidermis after 12 weeks of treatment.
